name: David Hasselhoff Lyrics Quiz | Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: An easy one to start you off: "I'm crazy for you, you're crazy for me"
questions.explanation:
Crazy For You.

	"Crazy For You" is a great song, with a Village People beat. I'm crazy for David!  It's from the album of the same name.

questions.text: "When the sun goes down on a Saturday night, you will find her on the street"
questions.explanation:
Hot Shot City.

	The song "Hot Shot City" is particularly good.  It's from the hit album "You Are Everything."

questions.text: "I headed down the track, my baggage on my back"
questions.explanation:
Looking for Freedom.

	"Looking for freedom, I've been looking so long!" That song still makes me shiver.  It's from David's first album, "Looking for Freedom."  This is the song with which he hit the big time; he released it when the Berlin wall fell, and the new German nation embraced it.

questions.text: "Fly into Montego Bay, let's go to Jamaica"
questions.explanation:
Do the Limbo Dance.

	"Come on and move your body down!" It makes me want to shake my groove thang! This is from the album "David", released in 1991.

questions.text: "They loved each other, like sister, brother"
questions.explanation:
Everybody Sunshine.

	"Everybody hands up!" That's right, hands up! Sunshine! Yay!  This is from the 1992 album of the same name.

options: Je T'Aime Means I Love You
The Best is Yet to Come
questions.explanation:
Dance Dance d'Amour.

	Hey everybody, do a sweet bossanova, just like David!  This comes from his 1993 album, "You Are Everything."  I love it when David sings in French.

questions.text: "We'll build a castle out of honesty"
questions.correct: Flying on the Wings of Tenderness
questions.explanation:
Flying on the Wings of Tenderness.

	This song is so touching.  Get close to someone you love and listen to it.  It's from the hit first album, "Looking for Freedom", from 1989.

questions.text: "You're a survivor, you'll be a hero for sure"
options: The Best Is Yet to Come
questions.explanation:
I Believe.

	This song is so stirring! If you need a reason to live, here it is!  This is a hit single from the show "Baywatch", and it's a duet with the beautiful Laura Branigan.

questions.text: "Whatever the hang-up, we're getting the gang up"
questions.explanation:
Is Everybody Happy.

	"Is everybody happy?"  I know I am, after I listen to David! Once again, this song is from the hit 1989 debut album, "Looking for Freedom."

Wir Zwei Allein.

	A bit tricky, 'cause it's in German, but all you real Hassel-fans will get it for sure!  It's from the great 1993 album, "You Are Everything."
